texts.text: Planned versions
This page is about planned versions of all editions of Minecraft. These updates either have major sources to their existence or have received development versions.
Note that only editions with known planned updates are listed here; if no known planned updates exist, the edition is left out.
Contents

1 Java Edition
1.1 1.19
1.2 Combat changes
2 Bedrock Edition
2.1 1.18.30
2.2 1.19.0
3 Education Edition
3.1 1.18.10
4 References
Java Edition
This article is about planned versions to the game. For planned features, see Java Edition mentioned features § Planned.
Main article: Java Edition 1.19
1.19, the first release of The Wild Update, is an upcoming major update to Java Edition set to release in 2022. This update was announced at Minecraft Live 2021.
Combat changes
Main article: Java Edition Combat Tests

The combat system is planned to be reworked in a future update, keeping the cooldown but only allowing the player to attack when fully charged. It is not known yet when those changes will be made, as they are developed in parallel to other features and will make it into the game "when they're good enough". The update in which they are included will also not be a combat-themed update.[1]
Bedrock Edition
This article is about planned versions to the game. For planned features, see Bedrock Edition mentioned features § Planned.
Main article: Bedrock Edition 1.18.30
1.18.30 is an upcoming minor update to Bedrock Edition with no set release date.
Main article: Bedrock Edition 1.19.0
1.19.0, the first release of The Wild Update, is an upcoming major update to Bedrock Edition set to release in 2022. This update was announced at Minecraft Live 2021.
Education Edition
Main article: Education Edition 1.18.10
1.18.10, the first release of Caves and Cliffs Part 2, is an upcoming major update to Education Edition. The update will bring Caves & Cliffs: Part II features to Education Edition.[2]
References
"Update: Custom Java Edition snapshot to test new combat mechanics (version 2)" – u/jeb_ on Reddit, August 15, 2019
"What's New in the Beta" (archived) – Minecraft Education Edition Support.
